secret_rule: Only items that are the title of a song by a Grammy Award-winning artist can be brought to the picnic.

conversation.content: To start, here are some examples of items you can bring: "hotel california" and "yesterday".

it seems like song titles are part of the rule, but there might be an additional condition that hasn't been fully uncovered yet. keep exploring and asking questions to discover the full rule!

based on the careful investigation of the examples and the game master's responses, here's my final rule hypothesis:

the rule seems to be: "song titles that have multiple words are allowed, but single-word song titles are not permitted."

the evidence supporting this hypothesis:
- multi-word song titles allowed:
  * "hotel california" (multiple words)
  * "bohemian rhapsody" (multiple words)
  * "stairway to heaven" (multiple words)

- single-word song title not allowed:
  * "imagine" (single word, but this seems to be an exception)
  * "happy birthday" (multiple words, but not allowed)

the slight wrinkle is the word "imagine" being allowed despite being a single word. this makes me slightly less confident, but the overall pattern strongly suggests a multiple-word requirement for song titles.

if i had another turn, i would try to test a few more single-word and multi-word song titles to confirm or refine this hypothesis. but given this is my final turn, this is my best interpretation of the underlying rule based on the available evidence.
